results.title: Instrumental program
results.creator_credit: Rex Tasker, F Whitman Trecartin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Halifax Music”.
Displays some of the talents developed by students within the Halifax School Music Department system. From choral groups to jazz bands these youngsters have fun with their music and in so doing seem to involve their audiences in that enjoyment.

results.title: Instructing the worker on the job
results.brief_description: A new female employee is told to do a job on the drill press; she is unable to do the job and is then shown how to do it; this does not have the desired effect and in distress she leaves the machine; the supervisor then takes more care over instructing the next young woman assigned to operate the machine, and she becomes a competent operator. Thus are the differences between telling, showing, and instructing demonstrated.

results.title: Instinct
results.creator_credit: James McCloy, Brenda Horsfield and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Man in the Making”.
The relationship between animal mothers and their young is built up by a series of complex instinctive responses, and today some scientists see similar kinds of behaviour patterns in human mothers and babies. The first almost automatic smile of a baby may be a simple instinctive action which plays an important part in its development. Children reared in an institution tend to lapse into a state of withdrawal. Speakers include: Dr Mavis Gunther, Dr R.A. Hinde and Dr J.A. Ambrose.

results.title: Instant arson: testing firebombs and incendiaries
results.brief_description: Discusses the effects of arson with firebombs and chemical incendiaries as ignition sources, and demonstrates different methods of extinguishing the resulting fire.

results.title: Insomnia
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description: This US Navy Training Film looks at the problem of insomnia, and the personal distress which it can cause. Indicates that the problem is widespread, suggests ways of alleviating it, and stresses individual differences.

results.title: Insight: exit
results.creator_credit: John Furia Jr and Jack Shea
results.brief_description: A dramatisation about a college senior who drops out of school and embraces the drug culture. The story follows: Peter and Mary are in love and Peter is forming a peace march whereupon he is arrested and one of his friends is killed. After this experience, Peter joins a “hippie” group who experiment in all types of drugs. Mary tries to get Peter away from drugs and those influencing him, but to no avail. As one of Peter’s friends nearly overdoses, Peter manages to save her and takes her to hospital where the Doctor tries to explain the dangers of drug taking. This film is used to explore the drug syndrome and show the futility of using narcotics. Written by John W. Zodrow.

results.title: Insight: director
results.brief_description: A fascinating “Profile” of a film director in which Anthony Asquith talks about his career going back to the days of the silent cinema; cutting, editing and finally directing; the setting up and shooting of a scene from a recent production; excerpts from his earlier works including “Tell England”. Mastery of the art and a sympathetic understanding of players are essential for quality productions. Includes interviews with Dirk Bogarde, Olivia de Havilland and Paul Massey.
